metadata.title: CVE-2019-19051 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the i2400m_op_rfkill_sw_toggle() function indrivers/net/wimax/i2400m/op-rfkill.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.11allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), akaCID-6f3ef5c25cc7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92').

linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1076.86').
